definition: to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: To improve my photographic skills, I joined a photography club.
sentences.chinese: 我參加攝影社，讓我的攝影技術精進。

sentences.english: This course is conducted by Enrichment Programme for Young Mathematics Talents, Department of Mathematics, The Chinese University of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 本科由香港中文大學數學系的數學英才精進課程主理。

sentences.english: And of course this would not be possible without diligently doing the exercises and studying the Fa.
sentences.chinese: 當然，如果不精進的學法煉功也是做不到的。

sentences.english: One tries to abandon wrong speech & to enter into right speech: This is one's right effort.
sentences.chinese: 努力祛除不正語建立正語，就是正精進。

sentences.english: One tries to abandon wrong view & to enter into right view: This is one's right effort.
sentences.chinese: 努力祛除邪見建立正見，就是正精進。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
